docs.name: MotoGP - The Story So Far
docs.teaser: Look back at the best of the MotoGP races from every round of the 2014 season with our 'Director's Cut' highlights.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 1 - Grand Prix of Qatar
docs.teaser: Raced under floodlights, the Qatar Grand Prix is now established as one of the most spectacular events on the MotoGP calendar.

docs.location: The Circuit Of The Americas, Austin
docs.name: MotoGP Race 2 - Grand Prix of The Americas
docs.teaser: The Circuit of The Americas is one of the most varied on the MotoGP calendar, with a good mix of fast straights and tight hairpins.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 3 - Grand Prix of Argentina
docs.teaser: The Termas de Rio Hondo circuit was revamped in 2012 to make the facility Latin America's most modern, safe and vibrant circuit.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 4 - Grand Prix of Spain
docs.teaser: The 250,000-capacity circuit at Jerez is one of the most popular MotoGP venues on the calendar and the focal point for a city fanatical about sport.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 5 - Grand Prix of France
docs.teaser: The Bugatti circuit at Le Mans is a tight track dominated by first-gear corners that place the emphasis on late braking and hard acceleration.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 6 - Grand Prix of Italy
docs.teaser: A blend of slow and fast turns with sweeping curves, long straights and off-camber corners make Mugello one of the most challenging circuits for the riders and engineers.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 7 - Grand Prix of Catalunya
docs.teaser: Considered to be one of the best designed circuits of the recent era, the Circuito de Catalunya won the much coveted IRTA ‘Best Grand Prix’ trophy in 2001 and has a capacity of 104,000 spectators.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 8 - Grand Prix of Assen
docs.teaser: The championship's longest-serving venue, the famous Assen circuit is a huge favourite with riders and fans alike, and is well known for its festive and extravagant atmosphere.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 9 - Grand Prix of Germany
docs.teaser: Numerous tight corners make the Sachsenring one of the slower tracks on the calendar but there is never any shortage of close racing action.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 10 - Grand Prix of Indianapolis
docs.teaser: The Indianapolis Motor Speedway is one of the most spectacular venues on the calendar as riders race down the famous main straight at 'The Brickyard'.

sportimage.name: Grand Prix Tile Small 11 - Czech Republic

docs.name: MotoGP Race 11 - Grand Prix of the Czech Republic
docs.teaser: Brno constantly changes in elevation as it sweeps across forested hillsides and its fast undulating corners test rider talent and engineering to the limit.

sportimage.name: Grand Prix Tile Small 12 - Great Britain

docs.name: MotoGP Race 12 - Grand Prix of Great Britain
docs.teaser: Completely revamped in recent years, the new and improved Silverstone circuit is one of the fastest tracks on the MotoGP calendar.

sportimage.name: Grand Prix Tile Small 13 - San Marino

docs.name: MotoGP Race 13 - Grand Prix of San Marino
docs.teaser: Close to the city of Rimini, the Misano circuit has updated facilities, track and grandstands that can hold up to 60,000 spectators.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 14 - Grand Prix of Aragon
docs.teaser: Popular with riders, the ultra-modern MotorLand Aragon circuit won the 2010 IRTA Grand Prix of the Year award in its debut year on the calendar.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 15 - Grand Prix of Japan
docs.teaser: Initially built as a Honda test facility, the Motegi circuit became home to MotoGP racing in 2000 and is a major attraction for motorsport fans all year round.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 16 - Grand Prix of Australia
docs.teaser: The scenic Phillip Island circuit is one of the fastest, most fluid, tracks on the calendar and continues to provide spectacular racing each year.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 17 - Grand Prix of Malaysia
docs.teaser: Specifically built for speed and exciting racing, the Sepang International Circuit in Malaysia is one of the world’s best facilities.

docs.name: MotoGP Race 18 - Grand Prix of Valencia
docs.teaser: The final venue of the year has a circuit layout that allows all parts of the circuit to be seen from any stand, helping to create a unique atmosphere on race days.
